body_html:
Thank you for your quick response!

There are two cases where this could be useful. The might be recurrences, since this would allow to make updates explicit. (I'm not sure here, though)

The second, which I am more interested in, is that I have several update functions I only want to apply to specific parts of my tensor, like with the following numpy code:

a = np.zeros((10,10))  # this could be any other tensor result from any kind of (differentiable) computation
b = [(1,3), (3,5), (2,4)]
for index in b:
    a[index] = some_other_function

Considering that tf.scatter_update looks like a function designed for these cases, it not being differentiable (if some_other_function is) requires me to do quite a lot of additional work to perform the same step.
